definition: Sichuan embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4])
short name for Sichuan 四川[Si4 chuan1] province/one of the Three Kingdoms 三國|三国[San1 guo2] after the Han dynasty, also called 蜀漢|蜀汉[Shu3 Han4], situated around what is now Sichuan province

sentences.english: In the Qing Dynasty, Shu Embroidery entered the market and an industry was formed.
sentences.chinese: 在清代，蜀绣进入市场和产业的形成。

sentences.english: Workshops and governmental bureaus were fully devoted to Shu Embroidery, promoting the development of the industry.
sentences.chinese: 局讲习班和政府完全致力于蜀绣，促进行业的发展。

sentences.english: The earliest record of Shu Embroidery was during the Western Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 蜀绣的最早记录是在西汉。

sentences.english: Shu embroidery enjoys a long history.
sentences.chinese: 蜀绣的生产具有悠久的历史。

sentences.english: Yue embroidery and Shu embroidery, right?

definition: Hunan embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
Suzhou embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
Guangdong embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
kesi or k’o-ssu, Chinese silk tapestry woven in a pictorial design
woven palm fiber (used in handicraft)/coir/woven coconut fiber
batik (color printing on cloth using wax)
papercutting (Chinese folk art)/to make paper cutouts
